title: Places I Have Ventured
name: Places I Have Ventured
description:
A Map by Largebloke

Places I have been to throughout Europe and the USA

properties.name: AI Prince Tech
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke500 brookfield street hartford ctThis is where Bill worked for 31 years before meeting me. Attached is a picture not many have seen before - Bill teaching. There is also a picture of him by the football field where he coached their football team to many wins over the years. My impression of the place whenever I visited was that it seemed like they have the same layout here as they do in all tv programmes about schools.

properties.name: Benidorm
properties.description: Posted by LargeblokeBenidorm SpainA great place to spend the weekend. It has great weather, a good gay nightlife as well as a minor football team.

properties.name: Berlin
properties.description: Posted by LargeblokeKurfürstendamm 35 10719 BerlinWe stayed in the Hotel California on the Kurfurstendamm. We went for an ice hockey tournament between the London Knights, Eisbaeren Berlin, Geneva and Munich Barons. We both enjoyed the city, the people were friendly, and at the time, it was dead cheap too. I\'d like to go back and see how much it has changed.

properties.name: Best Western
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke3001 N Federal HighwayOur favourite abode when in Ft Lauderdale. Cheap as chips, comfortable and clean.

properties.name: Blue Cross Arena
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke1 War Memorial Sq, Rochester, NYWe saw a rather dull game here between the Rochester Americans and the Grand Rapids Griffins. I will say that the arena had the best concession stands.

properties.name: Candlestick Park
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke  602 Jamestown Ave, San Francisco, CAI have visited a couple of times. I saw my first ever baseball game here in \'89 between the Giants and the Philadelphia Phillies. The next time was in \'99 to see an NFL game between the 49ers and the Carolina Panthers.

properties.name: Carolina Panthers Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke800 S Mint St, Charlotte, NC, USAWas the Ericsson Stadium when we went, but is now the Bank of America Stadium. I went here with my brother to see the Panthers lose to the New Orleans Saints.

properties.name: City of Quebec
properties.description: Posted by LargeblokeOld Quebec StreetMy favourite bar in London, especially now there is no smoke in there.

properties.name: Cumberland County Civic Center, Portland ME.
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke1 Civic Center SQ, Portland, MEHome of the Portland Pirates in the AHL. We have spent a couple of weekends up in Portland. A nice place, just a pity that the main gay bar, Blackstones is always completely packed.

properties.name: DCU Center
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke50 Foster Street, Worcester, MA 01608Home of the Worcester Sharks. I haven\'t been since they were the Ice Cats.

properties.name: Fenway Park
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke 4 Yawkey Way, Boston, MA, 02215Home of the Boston Red Sox. We were lucky enough to get tickets before the time when they sold out every game. We saw them beat the Cleveleland Indians in September 2000.

properties.name: Germain Arena
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke10900 everblades parkway, estero, florida, 33928Home of the Florida Everblades, a minor league hockey team in the ECHL.

properties.name: Gran Canaria
properties.description: Posted by Largeblokegran canariaLast time I went here was on a holiday with the lads. It\'s not a place I\'d like to go back to although I have heard that there is a good gay nightlife.

properties.name: Hartford Civic Center
properties.description: Posted by LargeblokeOne Civic Center Plaza, Hartford, Connecticut, 06103The scene of my first ever ice hockey match between the Hartford Wolf Pack and the Springfield Falcons. We go back as often as we can to see a few games.

properties.name: House of Blues
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke801 boardwalk, atlantic city, njWhere I saw Paul Stanley play. I must admit, there isn\'t a whole lot that could drag me back to this town as I really didn\'t like it at all.

properties.name: Icod de Los Vinos
properties.description: Posted by Largeblokeicod de los vinos, tenerifeWhere my Dad and step Mum live in the winter. Great views over the Atlantic, but the place is a little boring.

properties.name: Louisiana Superdome
properties.description: Posted by LargeblokeSugar Bowl Drive, New Orleans, La 70112, New Orleans, LAMy brother and I made a trip to New Orleans in 2004. We saw the a couple of games here - the first a college one between Tulane Green Wave and Louisville Cardinals, and then an NFL one between the Saints and the Carolina Panthers.

properties.name: Mass Mutual Center
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke1277 Main St, Springfield, MAHome of the Springfield Falcons, perennial underachievers in the AHL.

properties.name: Mile High Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke1701 Bryant Street, Denver, CO 80204Home of the Denver Broncos. This was my first ever NFL game, and the Broncos took on the Raiders. I was more amazed by the fighting in the stands than anything else, as there were fist fights going on in a few places. I came out of this place covered in beer and peanut shells. Quite an Experience!

properties.name: Mississippi Coast Coliseum
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke2350 Beach Blvd, BiloxiSaw an ECHL game between the Mississippi Sea Wolves take on Texas Wildcatters. Loads of goals, and a few fights too - a great game :)

properties.name: Prinsengracht
properties.description: Posted by LargeblokeWhere we stayed in Amsterdam. Two days here is enough for anyone if you don\'t like whores or smoking weird stuff!

properties.name: Sears Tower Skydeck
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke233 S Wacker Dr Ste 7200, Chicago, IL

properties.name: Sideline Sports Bar
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke 2031 Wilton Dr, Wilton Manors, FLJust over the road from Tropics. A good place to finish the night off. It does get a bit packed at the weekend, and the floor is as slippery as hell!

properties.name: Stadionul Republican
properties.description: Posted by LargeblokeKishinev MoldovaThe scene of my first ever England away game. That was after getting caught up in the post Euro \'96 excitement. Moldova was certainly an experience - we were the first tourists there, and we almost felt like the Beatles as our route from the airport to the stadium was lined by the locals. Mind you, they were staring rather than screaming :) This was the site of the smelliest toilet on earth, but it was still a great day out.

properties.name: Sun Devil Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke400 E Stadium Dr, Tempe, AZWe went here when the Arizona Cardinals were still playing here. They were playing against the New England Patriots, and it was as hot as hell. I ended up buying bottles of water just to pour over my head. New England kicked their arse too :) It is also the worst stadium I have been to. Everything is miles away, and as it is outdoors, it is just way too hot.

properties.name: TD Banknorth Garden
properties.description: Posted by LargeblokeCauseway Street, Boston, MA, United StatesWe saw the Boston Bruins take on the Montreal Canadiens here in 2003.

properties.name: The Desert Bear
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke530 Mel Avenue, Palm Springs, CaliforniaA great clothing optional resort.

properties.name: Tropics
properties.description: Posted by Largebloke 2004 Wilton Dr, Wilton Manors, FLMy favourite bar in the USA. Friendly bar staff, and a great crowd use this place.
